ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.2_0: At that time the monks from the group of six were storing many almsbowls.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.3_0: People who were walking about the dwellings saw this, and they complained and criticized them,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics store many bowls?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.5_0: Will they start up as bowl merchants or set up a bowl shop?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.6_0: The monks heard the complaints of those people
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized Udāyī,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.8_0: “How can the monks from the group of six keep extra bowls?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.9_0: After criticizing those monks in many ways, they told the Buddha ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.10_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.13_0: “... Foolish men, how can you keep extra bowls?
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...” ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.15_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.16.1_0: ‘If a monk keeps an extra almsbowl, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:1.17_0: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.1_0: Soon afterwards a bowl was given to Venerable Ānanda,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.2_0: but he wished to give it to Venerable Sāriputta
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.4_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having extra robes, Ānanda thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.5_0: Knowing that the Buddha had laid down a rule against having an extra robe, he thought,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.6_0: that a bowl shouldn’t be extra bowl.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.8_0: (but) you want to give this bowl to venerable Sāriputta,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.12_0: “How long is it, Ānanda, before Sāriputta returns?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.14_0: After giving a teaching, the Buddha addressed the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.15_0: “Monks, you should keep an extra almsbowl for ten days at the most.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.16_0: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:2.17.1_0: ‘If a monk keeps it for ten days at the most, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.2_0: it should be kept for ten days at a maximum.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.4_0: almsbowls that have neither been determined nor transferred to another.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.6_0: there are two kinds of bowl: the iron bowl and the clay bowl.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.7_0: And there are three grades of bowl: the large bowl, the medium bowl, and the small bowl.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.8_0: The large bowl: it takes half an _āḷhaka_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.9_0: The medium bowl: it takes a _nāḷika_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.10_0: The small bowl: it takes a _pattha_ measure of rice, a fourth part of non-staple food, and a suitable amount of curry.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.11_0: Anything larger than this is not a bowl, nor anything smaller.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.12_0: If one uses them beyond that, one commits an offense entailing relinquishment:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.13_0: it becomes subject to relinquishment at dawn on the eleventh day.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.14_0: The bowl should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.15_0: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.16_0: After approaching the Sangha, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.17_0: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl which I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.18_0: I relinquish it to the Sangha.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.19_0: After relinquishing it, he is to confess the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.20_0: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.21_0: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.22_0: ‘Please, Venerables, I ask the Sangha to listen.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.23_0: This almsbowl, which was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so, has been relinquished to the Sangha.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.24_0: If it seems appropriate to the Sangha, the Sangha should give this bowl back to monk so-and-so.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.25_0: After approaching several monks, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder and pay respect at the feet of the senior monks. He should then squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.26_0: ‘Venerables, this almsbowl which I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.27_0: I relinquish it to the venerables.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.28_0: After relinquishing it, he is to confess the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.29_0: The confession should be received by a competent and capable monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.30_0: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.31_0: ‘Please, I ask the venerables to listen to me.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.32_0: This almsbowl that was to be relinquished by monk so-and-so has been relinquished to you.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.33_0: If it seems appropriate to you, you should give this bowl back to monk so-and-so.’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.34_0: After approaching a single monk, that monk should put his upper robe over one shoulder, squat on his heels, raise his joined palms, and say,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.35_0: ‘This almsbowl that I have kept over ten days is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.37_0: After relinquishing it, he is to confess the offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.38_0: The confession should be received by that monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.39_0: The relinquished bowl is then to be given back:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.40_0: ‘I give this almsbowl back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.41.1_0: If it is more than ten days, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.42_0: If it is more than ten days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.43_0: If it is more than ten days, but he perceives it as less, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.44_0: If it has not been determined, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.45_0: If it has not been transferred, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.46_0: If they have not been given away, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.47_0: If they have not been lost, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.48_0: If they have not been destroyed, but he perceives that they have, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.49_0: If it is not broken, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.50_0: If it has not been stolen, but he perceives that it has, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.51_0: If she uses an almsbowl which is to be relinquished without first relinquishing it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.52_0: If it is less than ten days, but he perceives it as more, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.53_0: If it is less than ten days, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.54_0: If it is less than ten days and he perceives it as less, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.55.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.56_0: if, within ten days, it is determined, transferred to another, given away, lost, destroyed, broken, stolen, or taken on trust;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:3.58_0: if he is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.1_0: At one time monks from the group six did not give back a relinquished bowl.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.3_0: “You should not give a relinquished bowl to a relinquished bowl, but you do it.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np21:4.4_0: The first rule, the training rule on almsbowls, is finished.
